page.title: 05TREGARRICK FARM
page.content: Slightly bigger than most in the area, Tregarrick is a typical dairy/arable farm of 228 acres. Friesian and Hereford breeds provide the milking herd of 70 cows and various younger stock. They are milked twice daily in a herring bone parlour giving 350,000 litres of milk annually. The crops, of grass for hay and silage and barley for cattle feed, make the farm almost entirely self sufficient. The various stages of milk production call for a wide range of expensive machinery to be used on the farm including three tractors. The farm has been in the same family for three generations. The farmer told us that technology now plays a great part in modern farming, although the E.E.C. calls for less intensive production in the future.
